heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

nearest_lightning.status: The nearest lightning strike ever noted was on 13 May 2025, at 4.97 miles distance.

storm.status: There are no active storms in the area.  The previous storm started on 10 September 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (191°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1754 miles.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 4.9°C) and outside temperature (down 3.5°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.5 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 215 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1353 m), feels like temperature (up 7.0°C), outside temperature (up 5.1°C), and dew point temperature (up 1.7°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 215.2m lower than yesterday, 1056.1m lower than the past week, 1352.8m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 840m to a maximum of 1760m, averaging 938.0m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1994.1m and 2290m respectively.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; moderate and mild. Also, air moisture should feel ok and winds will be practically absent. Drizzle or light rain possible, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and the light is absent. Changeable conditions.
